intro: Perezia lactucoides subsp. lactucoides, commonly known as the common perezia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white ray florets and yellow disc florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It has a basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, herbaceous stems. Perezia lactucoides subsp. lactucoides is generally hardy and adaptable, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
